thread.title: Traffic chaos after Rugby World Cup game at Millennium Stadium |
thread.title_full: Traffic chaos after Rugby World Cup game at Millennium Stadium | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Traffic chaos after Rugby World Cup game at Millennium Stadium |
text:
Arriva Trains Wales says it hopes no one will wait longer than 90 minutes. Credit: ITV Cymru Wales News/Megan Boot All major routes out of Cardiff are currently facing heavy traffic as thousands of rugby fans make their way home.
Commuters on the M4 are facing long delays in both directions.
All lanes on the A470 are now open following an earlier accident involving a lorry but traffic in the area still remains slow.
Meanwhile, all major train services are extremely busy with 35,000 rugby fans catching trains home.
City of Cardiff @cardiffcouncil Follow **TRAFFIC ADVICE**use the A48 & A4232 and also Ocean Way / Rover Way to exit the city. Lots of congestion following tonight's RWC match.
18:50 - 23 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Last updated Wed 23 Sep 2015 Travel Wales Cardiff
